revised_title: The Discovery of Helium Production from Radium and Radioactive Emanation
tldr: The authors, Sir William Ramsay and Frederick Soddy, investigate the radioactivity of inert gases in the atmosphere and the production of helium from radium. They discover that the radium emanation withstands various chemical reactions and can be extracted and condensed using liquid air. Additionally, they find that helium is produced from radium bromide and that the emanation from radium can also produce helium.
